intro: Hieracium eriostachyum, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, often surrounded by a ring of bracts. Hieracium eriostachyum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
